interestingFact: Canada has the longest coastline in the world, stretching over 202,080 kilometers.
Japan has more than 6,800 islands, but the four largest make up 97% of its land area.
Australia is home to the Great Barrier Reef, the largest coral reef system in the world.
Brazil is home to the Amazon Rainforest, which produces 20% of the world's oxygen.
India is the world's largest democracy and has the second-largest population globally.
France is the most visited country in the world, with over 89 million tourists annually.
New Zealand was the first country in the world to grant women the right to vote, in 1893.
Germany has over 400 aquariums and zoos, which is more than any other country.
Egypt is home to the Great Pyramid of Giza, one of the Seven Wonders of Ancient World.
